perturbation.original_text:
“Affiliate(s)” shall mean with respect to any Party to this Agreement any entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under common
control with such Party. An entity controls another entity when it owns or controls, directly or indirectly, fifty-one percent (51%) or
more of the equity share capital issued and outstanding of the other entity or when it controls, on its own or jointly, the majority of the
composition of the Board of Directors of such other entity.
perturbation.changed_text: “Affiliate(s)” shall mean with respect to any Party to this Agreement any entity that is loosely affiliated, works in conjunction with, or has a strategic partnership with such Party. Determination of affiliation will be decided on a case by case basis by the parties involved.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by changing the definition of "Affiliate" to include strategic partnerships and loosely affiliated entities, rather than just entities under majority control (51% ownership or control of the board). This contradicts other contract sections that rely on the original definition to determine rights and obligations. Additionally, allowing case-by-case determination undermines the original intent of objectively defining affiliates, introducing legal uncertainty and potential disputes over obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless
terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for a term of 10 years, unless
terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states an indefinite term while the modified clause explicitly limits the term to 10 years creating a contradiction. This introduces uncertainty and enforcement issues in the event of a dispute.

perturbation.original_text:
14.1   IMPCO expressly agrees that during the existence of this Agreement, IMPCO shall not enter into any other Joint Venture Agreement or
Marketing/Distribution Agreement, with any company or person(s) in the Territory with respect to the Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.1   IMPCO expressly agrees that during the first 5 years of this Agreement, IMPCO shall not enter into any other Joint Venture Agreement or
Marketing/Distribution Agreement, with any company or person(s) in the Territory with respect to the Products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes non-compete obligations on IMPCO for the entire duration of the agreement, while the altered text limits this restriction to the first five years. This temporal inconsistency creates uncertainty and potential enforcement issues as it's unclear whether the non-compete applies after the fifth year.
